name: Kanchenjunga
significance: The third-highest mountain in the world and revered as a sacred mountain by the people of Sikkim.

name: Nanda Devi
significance: The second-highest peak in India, part of the UNESCO World Heritage Nanda Devi and Valley of Flowers National Parks.

name: Mount Trishul
significance: Known for its resemblance to Lord Shiva’s trident and popular among trekkers.

name: Kangto
significance: The highest peak in Arunachal Pradesh, located in the Eastern Himalayas.

name: Stok Kangri
significance: A popular trekking peak offering stunning views of Ladakh.

name: Kedarnath Peak
significance: Located near the Kedarnath temple and a favorite for experienced mountaineers.

name: Shivling Peak
significance: Known as the ‘Matterhorn of the Himalayas,’ it’s sacred to Hindus and a challenging climb.

name: Aravalli Hills
significance: One of the oldest mountain ranges in the world with historical and cultural importance.

name: Anamudi
significance: The highest peak in South India, located in the Western Ghats.

name: Sandakphu
significance: Offers panoramic views of Kanchenjunga and other high peaks.
